page.title: 01General Information
page.content: Our 'D' block covers the villages of {Cutsdean}and{Ford,}part of the village of{Temple Guiting}and other settlements such as{Hyde}and{Colman. As part of the North Cotswolds we have many hills and streams, the{River {Windrush}rises near to{Cutsdean,}flows through the rest of the block and eventually joins the Thames near Oxford. The land is mainly used for arable farming although there are several flocks of sheep, a few store cattle and tree plantations. Most buildings are built of stone quarried locally with stone roofs and large gardens. Most of the children under 11 go to the local school and then go either to the Westwoods Grammar school or to Bourton Vale Secondary Modern School. These schools are to be amalgamated in the near future at Bourton on the Water.
